body.p: The -plugin Profile Settings Management is meant to backup vital settings to a save place, and restore it in case of problems, or a new installation of , where own settings may have been reset.

section.title: Export (Backup) Profile Settings
section.p:
In order to export (= backup) profile settings, perform these steps:
In section Import or Export, select Export Profile Settings.
In section Profile Location, Export To: either type in the path to where the profile settings should be stored into, or select it from the drop down list.
In section Profile Location, Profile Name: either type in a profile name, or select it from the drop down list.
In section Profile Location, Profile Format: ensure to leave *.xml. This is the only supported file format, and it can not be changed by the user.
In section Profile Settings to be Exported, either check-mark Export All Settings (which exports all availabl settings), or check-mark any of the four profile settings Translation Editor, Workbench, Folder List Window, or Last Used Values.
Click on button Export Selected Settings to start the export function. A message window appears which confirms the successful export. In case the profile name should alreyd exist, a warning message appears which allows to either overwrite the existing profile, or to cancel the profile export.

section.title: Import (restore) Profile Settings
section.p:
In order to import (= restore) profile settings, perform these steps:
In section Import or Export, select Import Profile Settings.
In section Profile Location, Import To: either type in the path from where the profile settings should be imported from, or select it from the drop down list.
In section Profile Location, Profile Name: either type in a profile name, or select it from the drop down list.
In section Profile Location, Profile Format: ensure to leave *.xml. This is the only supported file format, and it can not be changed by the user.
In section Profile Settings to be Imported, either check-mark Import All Settings (which imports all availabl settings), or check-mark any of the four profile settings Translation Editor, Workbench, Folder List Window, or Last Used Values.
Click on button Import Selected Settings to start the import function. A message window appears which confirms the successful import.
